model

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Model
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RequestListener, java.io.Serializable

    public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
implements RequestListener, java.io.Serializable
    A class that contains the game's logic. Updates are called by a Controller.
    See Also:
    Controller, Serialized Form

      Removes an Entity from the Entities that will be processed during update().
      void reset(Entity.EntityType playerType, Request.RequestType resetMode)
      Resets the model by clearing all components on the screen and resetting variables to their initial state and adds a TrashSpawner and Player.
      void restore(RequestQueue rq)
      Adds all Entities in the Model to the View, sets the correct score and pollution level, and sets the RequestQueue for all Entities and components of the Model.
      void retireModel()
      Removes all Entities from the Model and View, and removes self from the RequestListener.

      Sets the RequestQueue for the Model

      Turns on the Trash Spawner if the state is true, off if the state is false.
      void update()
      Updates the model by updating all Entities, checking for and processing collisions, and checking for end-game conditions.

        See Also:

      • MAX_POLLUTION_LEVEL

        public static final int MAX_POLLUTION_LEVEL
        The maximum pollution level. The game ends once this level is reached.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCORE_INCREMENT

        public static final int SCORE_INCREMENT
        The amounts the score should be incremented by.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver
        The state of the game. True if the game is not running, false if it is. For testing purposes.

      • trashSpawning

        public boolean trashSpawning
        The state of the TrashSpawner. True if it is spawning trash, false if not. For testing purposes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Model

        public Model(RequestQueue requestQueue)
        Constructs the Model with its Bounds and RequestQueue. Starts a new game by calling reset().
        Parameters:
        requestQueue - The RequestQueue for the Model
        See Also:
        Bounds, RequestQueue

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset(Entity.EntityType playerType,
                  Request.RequestType resetMode)
        Resets the model by clearing all components on the screen and resetting variables to their initial state and adds a TrashSpawner and Player.

      • handleRequest

        public void handleRequest(Request request)
        Handles how a Request is processed.
        Specified by:
        handleRequest in interface RequestListener
        Parameters:
        request - The request to be processed
        See Also:
        Request

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the model by updating all Entities, checking for and processing collisions, and checking for end-game conditions.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Handles what should happen when the game ends. Tells the Controller the game is over by calling Controller.endGame().
        See Also:
        Controller

      • incrementScore

        public void incrementScore(int modifier)
        Increments the score by the specified modifer times SCORE_INCREMENT.
        Parameters:
        modifier - The amount to multiply the SCORE_INCREMENT by

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns the current score
        Returns:
        The current score

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity(Entity entity)
        Adds an Entity to the Entities that will be processed during update(). The Entity will also be added to the View through the requestQueue.
        Parameters:
        entity - The Entity to add to the Model

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity(Entity entity)
        Removes an Entity from the Entities that will be processed during update(). The Entity will also be removed from the view through the requestQueue.
        Parameters:
        entity - The Entity to be removed from the Model

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        Returns the current player.
        Returns:
        The current player

      • incrementPollutionLevel

        public int incrementPollutionLevel(int addition)
        Increments the current pollution level by the specified amount.
        Parameters:
        addition - The amount to add to the current pollution level
        Returns:
        The new pollution level

      • getCurrentPollutionLevel

        public int getCurrentPollutionLevel()
        Returns the current pollution level
        Returns:
        The current pollution level

      • getMaxPollutionLevel

        public int getMaxPollutionLevel()
        Returns the maximum pollution level specified by MAX_POLLUTION_LEVEL
        Returns:
        The amount specified by MAXIMUM_POLLUTION_LEVEL

      • getWorldBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getWorldBounds()
        Returns the Bounds of the world.
        Returns:
        The world Bounds

      • toggleTrashSpawning

        public void toggleTrashSpawning(boolean state)
        Turns on the Trash Spawner if the state is true, off if the state is false.
        Parameters:
        state - Determines whether the Trash Spawner is turned off or on

      • getEntities

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getEntities()
        Returns the ArrayList of Entities in the Model. For testing purposes.
        Returns:
        The Model's ArrayList of Entities

      • getSpawner

        public TrashSpawner getSpawner()
        Returns the TrashSpawner for the Model. For testing purposes.
        Returns:
        The Model's TrashSpawner

      • getThrownTrash

        public java.util.ArrayList<Trash> getThrownTrash()
        Returns the ArrayList of Trash that has been 'thrown'. For testing purposes.
        Returns:
        The Model's ArrayList of 'thrown' Trash

      • retireModel

        public void retireModel()
        Removes all Entities from the Model and View, and removes self from the RequestListener. For the purpose of loading in a new file, this one must be called on the old Model.

      • restore

        public void restore(RequestQueue rq)
        Adds all Entities in the Model to the View, sets the correct score and pollution level, and sets the RequestQueue for all Entities and components of the Model.
        Parameters:
        rq - The RequestQueue to set for the Model and all components

      • setRequestQueue

        public void setRequestQueue(RequestQueue rq)
        Sets the RequestQueue for the Model
        Parameters:
        rq - The RequestQueue to set the Model to
